text.p: These are the headlines selected from Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Debate stopped without winner: No leader manages to claim upper hand before moderator's collapse ends political jousting.
- Early end of debate costs Bloc leader his chance at key unity question: Duceppe misses the prize.
- Changing goals/Canadian hockey needs to develop better. How best to do it?: Game plan needed to fix system.
- Ontario Hydro to cut staff by 950.
- IDs at fingertip, Harris predicts: Coded images could replace health and hospital cards.
- Zairian rebels close in on Kinshasa: Government imposes curfew, calls on residents to take up arms to defend capital.
- Demand for office space soars: Major Canadian cities face shortage of large blocks in prime buildings, survey reveals.
- Digital accuses Intel of illegal copying: Files lawsuit seeking to stop computer chip maker from selling any more Pentium products.
- IBM stock sets 9-year high: Record close in sight, analysts say.
- 'Free market' urged by panel: 'Cornerstone' of task force's approach to financial services.
- Pipelines duel for shippers: TransCanada goes head to head with Alliance in the race to sign up shippers for new capacity that's set to come on stream in 1999.
- Sweetened offer turns up heat in Merfin battle.
